column4: This fortune program "Wanda the fish" where can I find/open the source to this?
it is likely a part of the gnome-panel.
how can I "open it up"?
I just want to see the source of it
sudo apt-get source gnome-applets
that is a guess, though.
alright, will try anyway
that is how you get the source of that package, and it sounds like the wanda would be somewhere in there.
yeah
we need to see the script
http://todotxt.com/library/todo.sh/ It should work though, I didn't code it :P
does cream produce a .java file in a directory somewhere on your system?

yes, I've got a .java file, no idea how to compile it though. I typed "java <filename>" and it gave me: "Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:", I know this file works, since it did on WinXp
javac <filename>
no such command
guess I need to dl smt, didn't find a package called javac, should I dl javacc?
sun-java5-jdk
ah, thought I had it, ty
sorry to bother you again: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: AK06_12/java <- managed to compile now, though now I got that error, and I'm sure it worked on WinXP
your program does not have a main method, so it can not be ran by itself.
right, weird, thanks, I'll go look for it then xD (bash.org worthy tbh)
close all synaptic add/remove programs, and aptitudes
